description: This course provides students with an intensive linguistic and cultural immersion experience in Ecuador. In-class activities focus on development of language skills and cross-cultural awareness. Outside of class, students improve their language proficiency and explore the cultural identity of Ecuador through a three-and-a-half-week home stay with a family in Quito; excursions and activities in and around the city of Quito; and field trips to the indigenous market of Otavalo, the Amazon region, and other areas in rural Ecuador. Completes foreign language requirement. Prerequisite: Spanish 231 with a minimum grade of B- or equivalent preparation. Open to first-year students.
name: Inter Span II-Ecuador
notes: Open to all students who meet the prerequisites. This is an off-campus course. You will find this course listed in Studio Abroad under its course title.
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Spanish 231 with a minimum grade of B- or equivalent preparation. Open to first-year students.
title: Intermediate Spanish II in Ecuador
